# Network Analysis

##### Calculate emprical regularized [correlation](#correlation), [biochemical](#biochemical) relationships and [structural similarity](#structural) networks. Each module supports rich `static`, `interactive` and `dynamic` network [visualizations](#visualize).

### [Translate]{.txbox_green}
##### Translate between > 200 bichemical identifiers.

#### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray}

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Select translation options. The `identifier` selects the column in the `col_meta` to translate. Use `from` and `to` to specify the identify of the selected `identifier` and what new `identifier` it should be translated to.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/translate/methods.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### View translation results.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/translate/results.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

### [Mapping]{.txbox_green}
##### Combine and create variable mappings to add to network visualization node and edge properties.

#### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray}

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Map the log base 2 transformed `fold-change` to its absolute value and sign. This is useful to normalize increases and decreases and encode their magnitude and direction of change using separate asthetics. 

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/mapping/methods.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Map the significance of a `p-value` to a binary (e.g. true or false) outcome. This is useful to separate asthetics for significant and non-significant `fold-changes`. The following examples would evaluate if the `p-value` is less than or equal to `0.05`.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/mapping/methods_p.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Combine mapped variables. This is useful to fine-tune asthetics based on custom combinations of mappings.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/mapping/methods_combine.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### View the results of the mapping process. Note you first need to `save` the results from `fold-change` and `p-values` prior to using them with the `combine` transformation.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/mapping/results.png){.bordered}
:::
:::


### [Correlation]{.txbox_green}
##### This module is used to create and `regularized` `correlation` networks @huge.

#### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray}

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Select correlation type and if `p-values` should be `False discovery rate` @p_adjust_BH corrected.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/corrmap/corr_methods.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Select regularizationm method based on rotation information criterion (ric), stability approach to regularization selection (stars) or extended Bayesian information criterion (ebic) @huge. Note you can also manually select the regularization `lambda` (higher lambda is more strict), but this needs to be done after a model is calculated. If no edges are returned using `manual` then try a lowe or less stict regularization.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/corrmap/reg_methods.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### View methods and summary for the calculated network.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/corrmap/results.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

### [Biochemical]{.txbox_green}
##### This module is used to calculate and `biochemcial` networks. Metabolomic precursor to product relationships are based on `KEGG` identifiers.

#### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray}

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Select [KEGG](https://www.genome.jp/kegg/) identifier column name in the data.

::: 

::: column

:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### View methods and summary for the calculated network.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/keggmap/results.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

### [Structural]{.txbox_green}

##### This module is used to calculate and `structural` simialrity networks. Metabolite  `structural` similarities are calculated based on overlap in Pubchem structural fingerprints defined by  `compound identifiers` or  [`CID`](https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/)

#### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray}

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### Select Pubchem [CID](https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/search/help_search.html) identifier column name in the data.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/chemmap/methods.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### View methods and summary for the calculated network.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/chemmap/results.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

##### This module is used to combine and visualize networks.

:::

::::: columns 
::: column 

##### `Update` network node attributes based on another compatible data set.

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/enrich/update_methods.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns

![](img/dave.network/enrich/results.png){.bordered}

#### [Visualize]{.txbox_gray}

::: column 


##### Visualize and modify network node attributes.

::: 

::: column 
![](img/dave.network/visualize/nodes_ui.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::: column

:::
